data.enText: hitting movement
an act of hitting a ball, for example with a bat or racket
What a beautiful stroke!

data.chText: 他以少于对手两杆的成绩获胜。
data.enText: He won by two strokes (= in golf , by taking two fewer strokes than his opponent) .
a single movement of the arm when hitting sb/sth

data.chText: 给他的惩罚是挨六教鞭。
data.enText: His punishment was six strokes of the cane.
in swimming/rowing
any of a series of repeated movements in swimming or rowing

data.chText: 她又划几下，游到了岸边。
data.enText: She took a few more strokes to reach the bank.
a style of swimming
Butterfly is the only stroke I can't do.

data.chText: （指挥船上其他桨手的）尾桨手
data.enText: the person who sets the speed at which everyone in a boat rows
gentle touch
an act of moving your hand gently over a surface, usually several times
He gave the cat a stroke.
of pen/brush
a mark made by moving a pen, brush, etc. once across a surface
to paint with fine brush strokes

data.chText: 他们大笔一挥，就把成千上万的人排除在福利制度之外。
data.enText: At the stroke of a pen (= by signing sth) they removed thousands of people from the welfare system.
action

data.chText: （成功的）举动；（高明的）举措；（巧妙的）办法；（成功的）事情
data.enText: a single successful action or event
Your idea was a stroke of genius .

data.chText: 我在这儿看见你纯属巧遇。
data.enText: It was a stroke of luck that I found you here.

data.chText: 在头版上披露谋杀犯的身份，这是一个大胆的举措。
data.enText: It was a bold stroke to reveal the identity of the murderer on the first page.

data.chText: 她一向什么活儿都不干。
data.enText: She never does a stroke (of work) (= never does any work) .
of clock
each of the sounds made by a clock or bell giving the hours

data.chText: 等到钟敲第一下时就是9点整。
data.enText: At the first stroke it will be 9 o'clock exactly.
on the stroke of three (= at 3 o'clock exactly)
illness
a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel (= tube) in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly
to have/suffer a stroke

data.chText: 他因中风身体局部瘫痪了。
data.enText: The stroke left him partly paralysed.
at a (single) stroke
at one stroke
with a single immediate action

data.chText: 他们威胁要一下子砍掉整个项目。
data.enText: They threatened to cancel the whole project at a stroke.
put sb off their stroke

data.chText: 扰乱某人；使某人乱了方寸
data.enText: to make sb make a mistake or hesitate in what they are doing
touch gently
to move your hand gently and slowly over an animal's fur or hair

data.chText: 这条狗真漂亮。我可以摸一摸吗？
data.enText: He's a beautiful dog. Can I stroke him?

data.chText: 轻抚，抚摩（物体表面或头发等）
data.enText: to move your hand gently over a surface, sb's hair, etc.

data.chText: 他深情地抚摩着她的头发。
data.enText: He stroked her hair affectionately.
move sth gently
to move sth somewhere with a gentle movement
She stroked away his tears.

data.chText: 他轻轻一触，把球踢进门柱之间。
data.enText: He stroked the ball between the posts.
be nice to sb

data.chText: 待（某人）非常好；（尤指）顺着（某人）以便为自己办事
data.enText: to be very nice to sb, especially to get them to do what you want

means: 抚摩(物体表面或头发等)

data.enText: at a (single) stroke
at one stroke
with a single immediate action

data.chText: 他们威胁要一下子砍掉整个项目。
data.enText: They threatened to cancel the whole project at a stroke.
put sb off their stroke

data.chText: 扰乱某人；使某人乱了方寸
data.enText: to make sb make a mistake or hesitate in what they are doing

tr: a light touch with the hands
(sports) the act of swinging or striking at a ball with a club or racket or bat or cue or hand
example: it took two strokes to get out of the bunker
a good shot requires good balance and tempo
he left me an almost impossible shot

tr: any one of the repeated movements of the limbs and body used for locomotion in swimming or rowing
a mark made on a surface by a pen, pencil, or paintbrush
example: she applied the paint in careful strokes

tr: a punctuation mark (/) used to separate related items of information
anything that happens suddenly or by chance without an apparent cause
example: winning the lottery was a happy accident
the pregnancy was a stroke of bad luck
it was due to an accident or fortuity

tr: the maximum movement available to a pivoted or reciprocating piece by a cam
the oarsman nearest the stern of the shell who sets the pace for the rest of the crew
(golf) the unit of scoring in golf is the act of hitting the ball with a club
a sudden loss of consciousness resulting when the rupture or occlusion of a blood vessel leads to oxygen lack in the brain

example: You have to stroke the boss

tr: strike a ball with a smooth blow
touch lightly and repeatedly, as with brushing motions

value.def: If you stroke someone or something, you move your hand slowly and gently over them.

example.ex: Carla, curled up on the sofa, was smoking a cigarette and stroking her cat...
example.tran: 卡拉正蜷缩在沙发上，一边吸着烟，一边轻抚着她的猫咪。

example.ex: She walked forward and embraced him and stroked his tousled white hair.
example.tran: 她走上前拥抱他并轻抚他凌乱的白发。

value.def: If someone has a stroke, a blood vessel in their brain bursts or becomes blocked, which may kill them or make them unable to move one side of their body.

example.ex: He had a minor stroke in 1987, which left him partly paralysed.
example.tran: 他 1987 年曾患轻度中风，之后就半身不遂了。

value.def: The strokes of a pen or brush are the movements or marks that you make with it when you are writing or painting.

example.ex: Fill in gaps by using short, upward strokes of the pencil.
example.tran: 用铅笔向上短短地勾画几道来填充空白。

value.def: When you are swimming or rowing, your strokes are the repeated movements that you make with your arms or the oars.

example.ex: I turned and swam a few strokes further out to sea...
example.tran: 我转身向海里又游了几下。

example.ex: The boatmen accompany the stroke of their oars with the sound of their voices.
example.tran: 船夫们一边划桨一边喊号子。

value.tran: 划水动作;划桨动作;(游泳或划船的)一次划水

value.def: A swimming stroke is a particular style or method of swimming.

example.ex: She spent hours practising the breast stroke.
example.tran: 她花了数小时练习蛙泳。

value.def: The strokes of a clock are the sounds that indicate each hour.

example.ex: On the stroke of 12, fireworks suddenly exploded into the night.
example.tran: 12 点的钟声刚敲响，焰火便在夜空中绽放。

value.def: In sports such as tennis, baseball, cricket, and golf, a stroke is the action of hitting the ball.

example.ex: Compton was sending the ball here, there, and everywhere with each stroke.
example.tran: 康普顿一会将球打到这里，一会打到那里，每一拍的落点都不同。

value.def: A stroke of luck or good fortune is something lucky that happens.

example.ex: It didn't rain, which turned out to be a stroke of luck.
example.tran: 天没下雨，结果成了件幸事。

value.def: A stroke of genius or inspiration is a very good idea that someone suddenly has.

example.ex: At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.
example.tran: 当时，对他的任命犹如神来之笔。

value.def: If something happens at a stroke or in one stroke, it happens suddenly and completely because of one single action.

example.ex: The disease wiped out 40 million rabbits at a stroke...
example.tran: 该疾病一下子就使 4,000 万只兔子丧命。

example.ex: How can Britain reduce its prison population in one stroke?
example.tran: 英国如何能一下子减少其监狱服刑人数?

value.def: If someone does not do a stroke of work, they are very lazy and do no work at all.

example.ex: I never did a stroke of work at college.
example.tran: 我在上大学时懒得要命。

trans: 单（一次）行程
准时地

雷击；闪击；电击

垂直行程；上下行程；垂直移动

三生有幸；意外的好运；一次幸运；一次好运
(高尔夫球)比杆赛

行程；线条长度；笔画长度；划距；行程长度

笔顺；笔划顺序；笔画；笔画顺序；输入法
